page.title: 03Changes in employment
page.content: Marsworth of 1985 is virtually a dormitory village.From being one,the inhabitants of which ,either worked on the local farms or were employed by the Grand Union Canal, it has become one in which practically all the working population have to find employment outside the parish,many travelling as far as London. Since 1900 the population has doubled to 600 and the number of dwellings has doubled to 200. Way of life changed by mechanization of agriculture and the cessation of commercial traffic on the canal. At the beginning of the century women were employed in the now extinct straw plaiting.
